physicsobject.PhysicsObject

physicsobject.PhysicsObject Class Reference

PhysicsObject is the base class for objects that need to interact with other objects, like creatures, mechanisms, etc. More...

 Unique object ID.

 Name of object, used to look up the sprite.

 Faction of object, for use in reacting to collisions.
 loc
 Location of the object.
 vel
 Current velocity of the object.
 isGravityOn
 True if gravity should be applied during the update cycle.
 gravity
 Acceleration due to gravity, added to self.vel each update cycle.
 maxVel
 Maximum velocity in X and Y directions (handled separately).
 shouldApplyVelocityCap
 Controls if we limit self.vel to be less than self.maxVel.
 facing
 Direction object is facing (1: right, -1: left).
 sprite
 Sprite for animations and bounding polygons.
 collisions
 List of collisions received since the last update cycle.
 touchDamage
 Damage to do to other objects on contact.
 health
 Damage that can be sustained before discorporating.
 state
 Current state for movement logic.

Detailed Description

PhysicsObject is the base class for objects that need to interact with other objects, like creatures, mechanisms, etc.

It handles collision detection and provides a framework for more complex behaviors and AI.

  name 
)

Instantiate a new object.

Parameters:
loc The location in realspace coordinates of the object.
name The name of the object; also the path to its animations (e.g. 'data/images/maleplayer').

def physicsobject.PhysicsObject.getIsAlive (   self  ) 

Return if we are alive.

Returning false here causes the object to be removed from the game.

def physicsobject.PhysicsObject.processCollision (   self,
  collision 
)

Handle running into something.

Use self.adjustCollision() to modify ejection vectors and distances; use self.hit[Floor|Wall|Ceiling] to react to running into terrain of those types.

def physicsobject.PhysicsObject.setState (   self,
  state
